bioghist.p: Joseph Leidy (1823-1891) was one of the preeminent figures in the development of American science in the nineteenth century. He was a physician, naturalist, anatomist, and scientific illustrator. Following William Wagner's death in 1885, Leidy assumed the role of President of the Faculty of the Wagner Free Institute of Science, with special direction of the Biology Department. Leidy was Chairman of the Board of Curators at the Academy of Natural Sciences in Philadelphia, and is a central figure in that institution's history. He also taught courses at the University of Pennsylvania and at Swarthmore College.

scopecontent.p: This collection contains various drawings by Joseph Leidy and holograph letters by Joseph Willcox and Joseph Leidy. The 89 drawings of various animal structures, created between the mid 1840s and the mid 1870s, have been reproduced in part in Leidy's Fresh-water rhizopods of North America (United States Geological Survey, v. 12, 1879). The volume also contains Willcox's short introduction, which is a recollection of the last days of Dr. Leidy's life.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Wagner Free Institute of Science: Joseph Leidy pictorial material (91-001) is an unbound collection of Leidy's drawings (mostly rhizopods, but some other zoological illustrations); Academy of Natural Sciences: multiple collections of Joseph Leidy records.
